intro: Sabulina juniperina subsp. juniperina, commonly known as the Juniperina Sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale blue flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. It is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Its compact growth form and resilience make it a hardy species in harsh environments.
